title: Arsenal news: Graeme Souness exposed for Dele Alli/Granit Xhaka quotes | Metro News
text:
Jamie Carragher: This star should beat N'Golo Kante to Player of the Year award 
While Souness admits that the tackle – for which Alli received a straight red – was ‘unnecessary’, he believes that bit of ‘devil’ marks out a player with potential to be the very best. 
‘It was nasty and unnecessary, born out of frustration. He really snapped into it, intending to leave a bit on the guy, so he got what he deserved with the red card,’ Souness added. 
‘Yet that’s also one of the reasons he could become a top player. Alli has a bit of devil in him, an edge that most top players possess. As strange as it sounds, if I was his manager, I’d be quietly saying to myself: ‘Thank goodness he’s got that in him.” Xhaka was guilty of a similar tackle on Burnley’s Steven Defour last month (Getty Images) 
But one Arsenal fan has pointed out that this was a bit different from his comments after a similar challenge from Arsenal’s Granit Xhaka last month 
‘What isn’t registering with him? He’s obviously got the exploding head,’ Souness said on Sky Sports after Xhaka was sent off against Burnley. Graeme Souness comments on:
